intro: Hymenoxys ambigens var. floribunda, commonly known as the showy hymenoxys, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant produces showy yellow to orange composite flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are typically basal, with a rough, hairy texture, and the stems are often hairy as well. This species is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils and open habitats.
